p: Scutellaria baicalensis roots have been widely used in traditional Chinese medicine to treat viral infection [ 44]. In vitro and in vivo replication of SARS-CoV can be inhibited by the flavonoid baicalin ( 15), which is isolated from S. baicalensis. Numerous inhibitory activities were confirmed for baicalin (EC 50 at 48 h is 12.5–25 μg/mL and at 72 h is 25–50 μg/mL) by virtue of neutralization-based testing of the nine SARS coronavirus isolates [ 45].
